review: "Robin Year One" is a compelling coming-of-age story that resonates deeply with its exploration of friendship and moral development. The strong characterization of young Dick Grayson, especially his journey from orphan to hero, is both engaging and heartwarming. While the story doesn't have the spooky or suspenseful elements I usually enjoy, the moral and emotional depth, along with the vibrant art, make it a solid read. It's a bit lighter in tone compared to my favorite books, but it still delivers a meaningful and enjoyable experience.
